macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Declines Led by Cisco; Dow Down 0.1%, Nasdaq 1.1% Lower
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 53 points or 0.1% as of 11 a.m. Eastern time, while the Nasdaq composite dropped 1.1%, dragged down by Cisco as investors assess AI developments.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Hyperliquid Up 24% YTD Amid Crypto Market Rout; Plans New Trading Products
items.summary: Hyperliquid (HYPE), a decentralized crypto exchange, has risen 24% this year to an $8 billion market cap, ranking 12th largest, despite Bitcoin and Ethereum dropping 20-35%. The platform plans to launch new 'outcomes' contracts in 2026, potentially boosting trading volume.

items.title: Pax Gold Rises 16% YTD Tracking Gold Price Surge
items.summary: Pax Gold (PAXG), a gold-backed stablecoin, is up 16% for the year as it follows rising gold prices, standing out as a recommended investment amid broader crypto declines.

items.title: Bitcoin Futures Steady as Volatility Collapses, Signaling Bigger Move Ahead
items.summary: February Bitcoin futures prices are near steady in early U.S. trading on February 12, with volatility at low levels, suggesting a potential larger price movement is forthcoming.

items.title: Illicit Crypto Activity Hits Record $158 Billion in 2025, But Share of Total Use Declines
items.summary: TRM Labs reports illicit crypto transactions reached an all-time high of $158 billion in 2025, though this represents a smaller share of overall crypto activity as legitimate uses grow faster.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: ZENN: New AI Approach Uses Data 'Temperature' to Boost Prediction Accuracy
items.summary: Researchers at Penn State introduced ZENN (zentropy-embedded neural networks), embedding thermodynamic laws into deep learning for superior performance over larger models, with applications in Alzheimer's digital twins and foundation models for governments.

items.title: ZK-HybridFL: Privacy-Focused Federated Learning Outperforms Rivals on Blockchain
items.summary: New ZK-HybridFL framework combines zero-knowledge proofs, DAG ledgers, and sidechains for faster, more accurate decentralized AI training in image classification and language modeling, resisting adversarial attacks better than Blade-FL and ChainFL.

items.title: Princeton Professors Secure Schmidt Grants for AI in Humanities Research
items.summary: Meredith Martin and team receive up to $450,000 to build ML toolkit for analyzing hierarchical structures in poetry, fiction, and music across languages; Peter Henderson advances AI for legal understanding.

items.title: MIT's Gómez-Bombarelli Highlights AI-Simulation Synergy for Materials Discovery
items.summary: Rafael Gómez-Bombarelli discusses combining physics simulations with ML and generative AI to accelerate material science, noting industry adoption by Meta, Microsoft, DeepMind and U.S. DOE's Genesis Mission.

items.title: Khan Academy CEO Warns 10% AI-Driven Unemployment Could Feel Like Depression
items.summary: Amid predictions of mass job losses from AI, Khan Academy's CEO states even a 10% workforce reduction would trigger economic distress akin to a depression, sparking identity crisis debates.

items.title: AI Enhances Predictive Accuracy in Ex Vivo Human Tissue Drug Studies
items.summary: Machine learning integration with ex vivo tissue data improves pattern recognition and preclinical predictions, addressing donor variability to advance drug discovery and translational research.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PS5 Games 2XKO and Highguard Bomb, Leading to Layoffs
items.summary: Major PS5 titles 2XKO from Riot and Highguard from Wildlight Entertainment, released in January 2026, underperformed commercially, resulting in significant layoffs at both studios shortly after launch. This has sparked debates on live service game development amid mixed success of similar titles like Arc Raiders.

items.title: Kadokawa Confirms Duskbloods and Elden Ring Tarnished Edition for Switch 2 in 2026
items.summary: Kadokawa Group's latest financial report reaffirms that Duskbloods and Elden Ring Tarnished Edition remain on track for Nintendo Switch 2 release this year, easing concerns after their absence from a recent Partner Direct.

items.title: Konami Announces Silent Hill Transmission Livestream for February 12
items.summary: Konami schedules a Silent Hill Transmission on February 12 at 4 PM PT / 7 PM ET, following PlayStation State of Play, promising updates on the series including Silent Hill: Townfall and potentially the original Silent Hill remake.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play Scheduled for February 12 with Third-Party and Indie Focus
items.summary: Sony's 60-minute State of Play airs February 12 at 2 PM PT / 5 PM ET, highlighting third-party, indie games for PS5, and updates from PlayStation Studios, with speculation on titles like Saros, Phantom Blade 0, and Resident Evil 9.

items.title: Arc Raiders Hits 14 Million Sales, Branded a Blockbuster Franchise
items.summary: Embark Studios' extraction shooter Arc Raiders has sold 14 million copies worldwide, as announced by publisher Nexon, solidifying its status as a major success in the genre.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung Starts Mass Production of HBM4 Memory
items.summary: Samsung has begun mass production of HBM4, high-bandwidth memory for data centers, and shipped initial units to customers amid competition with SK Hynix.

items.title: Meta's Hyperion Data Center Deal Sparks Enron Comparisons
items.summary: Meta's $27 billion joint venture with Blue Owl for an AI data center raises concerns over off-balance-sheet financing resembling Enron tactics, though the company defends its compliance with accounting rules.

items.title: SoftBank Group Returns to Profitability on Tech Investments
items.summary: SoftBank swung back to profit in late 2025 driven by gains from OpenAI stake and other ventures like Ampere acquisition and ABB robotics deal.

items.title: AI Chip Shortage Drives Up Smartphone Prices
items.summary: Demand for chips fueled by AI is ending cheap data storage era, pushing prices higher and worsening supply shortages for smartphones.

items.title: Apple’s Siri Upgrade Faces Delays
items.summary: Apple's planned Siri upgrade has slipped, impacting its timeline for improvements.

items.title: SpaceX Labor Case Sees Jurisdiction Twist
items.summary: A legal case involving SpaceX labor issues has encountered a jurisdictional development.
